settings.title: Sexual Health Tests
settings.subtitle: Your sexual health is important to check regularly, especially if you have symptoms or concerns. Get your diagnosis with our testing kits to swiftly begin your treatment.

settings.title: Why get tested?
settings.text: If you are sexually active it is important to get regular testing, regardless of having any symptoms. Often, a virus or infection may not show noticeable symptoms, so having regular testing can alert you to any issues. Sexually transmitted diseases (STIs) require prompt treatment to prevent spreading infections to others. Most of the time, STIs won't cause any lasting damage to your overall health but they do need to be treated early to ensure you stay healthy.

settings.title: When should I be tested?
settings.text:
If you've noticed anything new or unfamiliar, you may have symptoms of an STI. At this time you should book a consultation to speak with our qualified doctors.

After they have determined what test is required, you'll be able to order it instantly and have it delivered to your door. If the test shows a positive result, then you and your doctor can work to find the best treatment option.

If you're sexually active you should get tested at least once a year. You should also get tested whenever you change partners.

settings.title: increase in gonorrhoea diagnoses from 2018 to 2019
settings.text: According to Gov.uk, there was a 26% increase in the number of annual gonorrhoea diagnoses between 2018 to 2019.

settings.title: increase in the number of males diagnosed with syphilis in the UK between 2013-2018
settings.text: According to NICE, the numbers rose from 775 to 1391 between 2013-2018. 75% of new diagnoses were men who have sex with other men. There was also a 35% increase in female diagnoses.

settings.title: Buy STD Checks online
settings.text: “There are a number of different tests that can be used to assess sexual health. These tests can be used to diagnose and treat sexually transmitted infections (STIs), as well as to identify other conditions that may impact sexual health. STI tests can be used to detect the presence of bacteria, viruses, or other organisms that can cause STIs. These tests can be performed using a variety of methods, including swabs, blood tests, and urine tests!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.title: Complete A Quick Online Consultation Form
settings.text: Fill out a quick and simple online consultation form to find out what products you are eligible for.

settings.title: Checkout Securely
settings.text: Once you have completed your consultation and selected your treatment, you can securely checkout online.

settings.title: Express Delivery
settings.text: You will then receive your order the next working day using our express next-day courier service, dispensed from one of our verified GhPC partner pharmacies in the UK.

settings.title: How does an at-home sexual health test work?
settings.text: When you order a sexual health test online, it will arrive with all the equipment and instructions needed to determine a diagnosis. Depending on the test, you will be required to collect a sample. Samples can include swab tests (from the vagina or throat), urine stool or semen. Once the sample is collected, you will send the sample to the labs in the packaging you receive in your kit. The labs will process the sample and pass that information to you and your doctor.

settings.title: What are the most common STIs?
settings.text:
The most common types of STIs include:

Chlamydia

Gonorrhoea

Trichomoniasis

Genital warts

Genital herpes

Pubic lice

Scabies

Syphilis

Human papillomavirus (HPV)

settings.title: How do I know if I have an STI?
settings.text:
Most of the time, an STI will have noticeable symptoms that you will see or feel.

If you are worried that you may have an STI, it's best to get tested so that you can start the relevant treatment and lessen the spread.

Symptoms of STIs can range from:

Unusual discharge from the vagina, penis or anus

Pain when urinating

Lumps or skin growths around the genitals or bottom (anus)

A rash

Unusual vaginal bleeding

Itchy genitals or anus

Blisters and sores around the genitals or anus

Warts around the genitals or anus
Warts in your mouth or throat

settings.title: Who are the most at risk of an STI?
settings.text:
People who are at higher risk of contracting an STI include:

Men who have sex with men

Commercial sex workers

Clients of commercial sex workers

People from countries with higher rates of STIs. High-risk regions include: Sub-Saharan Africa, South-East Asia and Latin America/Caribbean.

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.text: All orders placed before 14:00 from Monday to Friday will be dispatched that day. The orders are sent using 24 Hour Tracked delivery provided by Royal Mail. Items will usually arrive the very next day after the order has been placed. We also provide tracking for your orders to check the status and location of your parcel.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: How is the medication packaged?
settings.text: All our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.
